name: lizjones
text: Who carries that much cash on them?

name: gusplease
text: Obviously the same type of guy who buys 365 pairs of briefs at 9:41 on a Friday morning.

name: cryptfiend85
text: It looks like Roast Beef is deliberately avoiding creating a paper trail. I guess he doesn't want any record indicating he can't be bothered to launder his undies.

name: agika
text: So he has enough underwear that he can go for a year without wearing the same pair of briefs twice?  This supports the OCD theory postulated earlier, methinks.

name: evolume
text: 9:41 am so he can start fresh today

name: cailetshadow
text: 9:41 am to beat the rush. He has purchased the store's entire stock.

name: greyfield
text: I should hardly think a place called Underpants Time should be sold out of underpants so easily. I mean, were I to go to a place called Underpants Time only to find out it is not indeed underpants time, I would be hella pissed.

name: greyfield
text:
Also, while I'm hardly surprised Beef reads Wired, I've never really gotten into the spirit of it. The magazine is very pedestrian. I prefer Technology Review myself.

And who on earth eats Surf and Turf and pumpkin pie at 9:30 in the morning? And what kind of restauranteur would serve such things at 9:30 in the morning? More to the point, what kind of sushi restaurant is open at 9:30?

The underground is a realm of mystery and confusion.

name: theguitarhero
text: Beef is wasting money on buying the hard copy of Wired. They put up all the good articles on their website, and also have several articles that aren't fit for print/too timely to put in the actual magazine.

name: hal
text:
Given that cats are crepuscular, it makes perfect sense.

Science

name: tristanhw
text: He must've been going fast to go to the shopping plaza from the restaurant, get 365 pairs of underpants to the counter, and then pay for them in 9 minutes. Thats a guy who doesn't mess about.

name: luckypyjamas
text: A comment left by luckypyjamas was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by dimenur, chivalress, novacaine)

name: idsyen
text: I think there is a chance that our friend tristanhw may hail from England, where his chosen phrasing is more common.

name: luckypyjamas
text:
ah, that could well explain it

as far as british dialect, i only know cockney slang, and only a little of that

instead of "feet" they say "plates of meat"?

i have been informed by a reliable source that this is true

name: varnish
text: Was your reliable source George Orwell, by any chance? Because I wouldn't trust that fella, if I were you. Never trust a man who goes around shootin' elephants.

name: luckypyjamas
text: no just a friend in britain

name: sirhan_duran
text: ...your name is spelled "pyjamas"

name: luckypyjamas
text: i find that has more character than the standard pajamas or pjs

name: luckypyjamas
text: if you must know

name: jhunter
text: I would not enjoy your comments half so much if the lack of capitalisation coupled with your display picture didn't make me picture a sheepish NoCal t-rex expounding on his favoured nuances of wordplay

name: troy_convers
text: BWAH HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I so love it when you Yanks talks like London tourists! It's put such a smile on my boat race!

name: spinynorman
text: This is inexplicably hilarious

name: tristanhw
text: New Zealand, but I have been to the "motherland" on occasion

name: pa_ass_nts
text: Beef withdraws all the money he could possibly need before shopping, so he can pay cash.

name: pa_ass_nts
text: ... dammit. Anyone how know computers as well as Beef(like playin' a piano, remember?) wouldn't trust EFT.

name: softerworld
text: there's some precedent

name: softerworld
text:
not working? I'm trying to post this, anyway:

http://achewood.com/index.php?date=01162003

name: phthoggos
text: a fellow from Circumstances.

name: pascal
text: Under Pants instead of Underpants--is it a typo, or clever wordplay? All right Onstad, you win this round.

name: catachresis
text: A Thing is thrown onto Beef's plate with a delicate trajectory

name: wolfslice
text: yeah man what the hell is that thing.

name: senseihollywood
text: see below...

name: fuzzyshoo
text: It would be the "Surf" portion of his order, the shrimp course

name: alejandroadam
text: a taste for black licorice. the sign of a true programmer.

name: delzhand
text: A comment left by delzhand was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by iaintnogent, Connellingus, SotiCoto)

name: hollis
text: It says "please pay cashier."  Maybe they have a tip jar up there.

name: acefalco
text: I remember a simpler time in life, when people left cash on the table as the tip.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Underpants Time sounds like a working man's Victoria's Secret.

name: senseihollywood
text:
it's a shrimp from the hibachi chef,no? ...as he flips his spatula all hollerin' CHING CHONG WING WONG...

Beef internalized this action as a smug mockery of his melancholy, ergo= no tip

name: clockworkorange
text: isn't "ergo=" redundant?

name: salo
text: I just assumed that he turned the o in ergo into a smiley face, to accentuate the general, apathic "oh, noooooo" feeling of the no tip reciever. The '=' is after the 'o' instead of the (more common) other way around since Japan is on the other side of the planet.

name: sargasm
text: Beef apparently bought Milklin an Asahi.  How nice.

name: tasteful
text: a $9 asahi

name: connellingus
text: Roast Beef goes commando every February 29.

name: deancain29
text: all his shopping is done within 22 minutes

name: senseihollywood
text:
wow good catch...

now who eats Tepanyaki at 9:32 am?

That indeed is an early-bird special...

name: mercuri0us
text: And drinks Asahi at 9:32 am

name: afronaut
text: Tepenyaki motherfriends

name: straw
text: I think that paying all in cash is a function of the Underground economy.  They can't get recognized by credit card companies or else the humans will find out and put a stop to that.  But I guess that doesn't mean that there can't be Underground credit companies.  That might get tricky with the federal govm't. Cat macro-economics is Achewood.

name: senseihollywood
text: here you go:

name: tbtabby
text: I don't know what's harder to believe: that Ray would have a credit card that expired six years before he got it, or that it wouldn't expire for 94 years afterward.

name: ford
text: Actually i find the 94 years one really easy to believe.  It's his damn bank.

name: tasteful
text: i like how he went all out and made it expire in december of 2099

name: tasteful
text: whatever

name: tinhand
text: A comment left by tinhand was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by shammack, deathpiano, godfatherofsouls)

name: zem
text: the purpose of 365 pairs of underpants is pretty obvious without mr. costanza's help

name: aliiis
text:
ITS ALWAYS TIME FOR
UNDER PANTS

(makes me laugh to no fixed end)

name: mercuri0us
text: especially the space between "UNDER" and "PANTS"

name: theguitarhero
text: Over Pants Time comes after.

name: heccibiggs
text: That space makes me put the emphasis on pants. As in, "under pants " as opposed to " un derpants". You know?

name: patkun
text: How often have we seen that little balding guy? Wasn't he at SaniTaco as well?

name: phthoggos
text: You'd think a brother could get a bulk discount

name: redphillip
text: $2.99 each is the discount price.

name: redphillip
text: Sorry, is -- I was't paying attention that it's BBcode, not HTML.

name: spinynorman
text: That short bald dude eating with beef is the same guy who came to meet lyle at his pornographic taco stand.

name: jonnay
text: A "Beef" day ends promptly at 9:54am.

name: tekende
text: No, it ends later, after Beef has read his Wired magazine and the book about description framework (whatever that is).

name: mindbnder
text: My vote changed the rating from a 4.1 to a 4.2. I have never been so proud. Now, I can die, happy, at peace.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: A comment left by jujubeesforjesus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mashisoyo, fmercury, theplaidknight, Wulvaine, foea)

name: mindbnder
text: yet the rating remains a 4.2, so my happiness remains, unabated.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: Its cool, I didn't really give it a 1.  I wouldn't do that.  Not on Beef's me day.  Im just sassing you and your excellent avatar.

name: mindbnder
text: I chubbied your appreciation of my avatar.

name: tasteful
text: i lamed you for that lame chubby

name: bjorntd
text: I really like this strip. I wish Onstad would do more in this format, using the basic ephemera of life to tell in more personal ways the narrative of basic living. It makes me feel a voyeur, exploring the life of this cat with a Swatch and a black t-shirt.

name: puguglypress
text: He's the kind of person who eats black licorice chews. This tells us a lot.

name: charchar
text: If it was an honest-to-Betsy Beef-day, he would have taken off the awful swag and done it nude.  The way god intended.

name: drago25
text: White briefs! my man

name: canusdivinus
text: Beef must buy hell of fancy briefs, for three bucks a pop.

name: tekende
text: No kidding, I pay like 8 bucks for a pack of three or something.

name: mangecoeur
text: How come the cashier gave him 95 cents of change instead of 35 cents? She probably was under his spell because of his new look.

name: tekende
text: What? Where does it say 95 cents?

name: mikeronomicon
text: Underpants are an evil and oppressive curse foisted on us by knicker knitting merchants of doom who chant "all your monies are belong to us." Bastards.

name: i_love_kate
text: Oh, man. Wagyu beef frief up Tepanyaki-style at a fancy restaurant remains one of my most fondly-remembered eatin' memories to this day. Was so flavoursome.

name: theguitarhero
text: Everyone needs a "me" day. It's a basic necessity.

name: greenkoolayd
text: is sales tax really 8.25%?  thats fucking ghetto...

name: rayonatoilet
text: A rather lame comic until you notice that Beef buys one pair of under pants for every day of the year. Let's hope this isn't a leap year.

name: atypicaloracle
text: The cat has surf 'n' turf for breakfast, then walks into an underwear boutique cold carrying a briefcase of semolas. We all wish we could be just a -little- like Beef.
